name: Multi-Factor Authentication
description: MFA enforcement for all privileged, remote, and administrative access to Rackspace production environments. RSA authentication manager provides rolling PIN tokens. NextGen Bastion Hosts (Balabit shell control box) enforce MFA at application layer before granting access to in-scope environments. Confirmed in SOC 2/3 reports (2020-2024) and compliance page. com/compliance.

name: Role-Based Access Control
description: RBAC model enforcing least privilege across production and corporate environments. SailPoint IdentityIQ provides governance-based IAM with automated access certifications, policy management, and access request/provisioning workflows. Access granted based on manager approval and job function. Confirmed in SOC 3 FY2024 technology description.

name: Privileged Access Management
description: Elevated or administrative access rights managed through SailPoint IIQ tool with review/approval workflow. TACACS+ clearance checked by Cisco ACS software for network device access; all commands authorized and accounted for via ACS. Bastion host isolation between in-scope and out-of-scope environments.

name: Automated User Provisioning and Deprovisioning
description: SailPoint IdentityIQ automated workflow adds users to approved groups upon manager approval. User privileges to in-scope systems revoked upon termination; physical access disabled within 24 business hours. Job role changes trigger access rights modification via TES department.

name: Active Directory Domain Segregation
description: Three-forest Active Directory architecture: Corporate AD for Rackspace employee authentication, Intensive AD for managed customer environments, Global RS AD for customer-only accounts. Parent-child trust between Intensive and Global RS AD. Rackers require active Corporate AD account plus Intensive AD credentials to access customer environments.

name: Bastion Host Isolation
description: NextGen Bastion Hosts (Balabit shell control box appliances) provide application layer filtering and proxying of connections into in-scope environments. Enforce MFA and create isolation between in-scope and out-of-scope environments. All privileged sessions recorded and auditable.

name: Periodic Access Certification Reviews
description: SailPoint IdentityIQ automated access certification campaigns. Management reviews access privileges periodically to confirm continued business need. Access revoked when no longer required due to role change or separation. Physical security policies and procedures reviewed annually.

name: Customer Portal Access Control
description: MyRackspace Customer Portal provides authenticated web application for customer account management, service requests, firewall rule changes, and configuration changes. Customer environments appropriately segregated via Organizational Units within Intensive and Global RS Active Directories.

name: Network Device Access Control (TACACS+)
description: Terminal Access Controller Access Control System (TACACS+) manages authentication, authorization, and accounting for all Cisco networking devices (ASA firewalls, Catalyst/Nexus switches, routers) in the data center hosting services system. Cisco ACS software checks TACACS clearance; all commands authorized and logged.

name: SSL/TLS Encrypted Portal Sessions
description: All connections to Rackspace Customer Portals encrypted using SSL or TLS protocols. Prevents credential interception and session hijacking during customer interactions with management interfaces.

name: ADFS Federated Identity
description: Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) provides standards-based secure sharing of identity information between trusted business partners (federations) across extranet. Enables SSO and federated authentication for partner and customer integrations.

name: Session Management and Timeout
description: Enforced session timeouts for administrative and customer portal access. Inactive sessions terminated after defined periods per FedRAMP and SOC 2 requirements. Re-authentication required after timeout. Inferred from FedRAMP Moderate baseline AC-12 and SOC 2 CC6 requirements.

provenance.primary_data_source: FedRAMP JAB Moderate ATO, SOC 2 FY2024

name: Endpoint Detection and Response (CrowdStrike Falcon)
description: CrowdStrike Falcon deployed on all managed endpoints providing next-generation antivirus, endpoint detection and response, and cyber threat intelligence. Real-time protection with continuous telemetry to 24x7 Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC). Confirmed in SOC 3 FY2024 and Acrolinx customer reference. Rackspace also responded to July 2024 CrowdStrike Falcon sensor update incident across managed fleet. com/blog/rackspace-technology-response-to-crowdstrike-july-incident.

name: File Integrity Monitoring (Trend Micro)
description: Trend Micro Cloud One - Workload Security (TRND) provides SaaS-based file integrity monitoring (FIM) and log inspection across production systems. Detects unauthorized changes to critical system files, configurations, and registry settings.

name: Endpoint Hardening and Configuration Baseline
description: Standardized hardening baselines for server and workstation operating systems aligned with CIS Benchmarks and NIST 800-53 CM family requirements. Configuration changes managed through documented infrastructure change management procedures reviewed per ISO 27001/2. com/compliance, SOC 2 FY2020 operational security description.

name: Anti-Malware Protection
description: CrowdStrike Falcon provides next-generation antivirus capabilities including behavioral analysis, machine learning detection, and signature-based scanning. Complements EDR with preventive malware blocking. Part of integrated security suite confirmed in SOC services description. com/security/on-premises-security.

name: Managed Backup Agent
description: Managed backup environment consists of servers in each data center utilized for automated backup and recovery operations. Backup agents deployed on customer and infrastructure systems per backup schedules and retention policies.

name: Mobile Device Management
description: MDM controls for corporate mobile devices accessing Rackspace systems and email. Enforced encryption, remote wipe, PIN/biometric lock, and approved application lists. Inferred from ISO 27001 A.8.1 (User Endpoint Devices) certification scope and remote workforce.

provenance.primary_data_source: ISO 27001 cert IS 636168, operational inference from 9,600+ employees

name: Network Segmentation (VLAN Isolation)
description: Customer environments isolated via virtual networks (VLAN) to logically separate customer traffic. VLANs ensure packets switched only between ports designated on same VLAN, preventing cross-customer data leakage. Different broadcast domains ensure segmentation among Rackspace customers.

name: Firewall Management
description: Firewall rule sets managed by authorized Rackspace employees with TACACS clearance. Customer firewall rules modified through authenticated MyRackspace portal requests. All firewall commands authorized and accounted for via Cisco ACS. Rule changes follow documented infrastructure change management procedures.

name: Intrusion Detection System (Palo Alto)
description: Palo Alto network devices perform advanced traffic inspection including both network layer and application layer inspection to detect malicious activity. Alerts fed to SOC for investigation and response. Part of integrated security operations suite.

name: Web Application Firewall
description: WAF protects web applications against data breaches and security threats. Bolsters security and performance for customer-facing and internal web and mobile applications. Part of application security service offering. com/security/on-premises-security.

name: DDoS Mitigation
description: DDoS protection for Rackspace infrastructure and customer environments. Multiple transit providers (4 providers ranked top 5 globally by Dyn) enable traffic shifting during attacks. Network design with no single points of failure. com/about/data-centers.

name: VPN and Encrypted Remote Access
description: Encrypted VPN connections for remote administrative access to Rackspace environments. MFA required for all remote access sessions. Bastion host architecture provides additional isolation layer. Inferred from SOC 2 AC-17 remote access controls and bastion host confirmation.

name: Network Cable Security
description: Properly trunked and secured cables across all data center facilities. Physical cable management prevents unauthorized tapping and ensures signal integrity. Part of network infrastructure controls confirmed on compliance page. com/compliance.

name: Proactive Network Monitoring and Route Management
description: 24x7x365 proactive network monitoring and route management across all data center network infrastructure. Shift traffic across 4 transit providers as necessary. Guaranteed uptime backed by SLAs. com/compliance, rackspace.com/about/data-centers.

name: RackConnect Global Private Network
description: Resilient private fiber network interconnecting Rackspace data centers globally. Provides multiple direct on-ramps to AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud, plus connectivity via Equinix Fabric and Megaport. Enables hybrid/multicloud architecture without public internet traversal. com/cloud/vmware.

name: Network Access Control Lists
description: ACLs enforce traffic filtering rules on network devices controlling ingress/egress between zones. Combined with VLAN isolation and firewall rules to implement defense-in-depth network security. Managed through TACACS+-controlled change process. Inferred from network architecture and FedRAMP/PCI DSS network segmentation requirements.

name: Encryption in Transit (TLS/SSL)
description: TLS/SSL encryption for all customer portal connections, API communications, and inter-system data transfers. Customer portal connections encrypted per SOC 2 GRP 24. API endpoints secured with OAuth 2.0 and TLS. rackspace.com.

name: Encryption at Rest
description: Data at rest encryption for customer data stored in Rackspace-managed environments. AES-256 encryption for storage volumes in FedRAMP and PCI DSS scope. Key management procedures per ISO 27001 A.8.24 and NIST 800-53 SC-12/SC-28.

provenance.primary_data_source: FedRAMP Moderate ATO, PCI DSS Level 1, ISO 27001 cert

name: Data Classification Labeling
description: Data classification scheme enforcement with defined handling requirements per classification level (Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted). Applied to documents, systems, and storage. Drives downstream controls including encryption, access, retention, and disposal. 5.12-A.5.13, pol-016.

name: Data Loss Prevention
description: DLP controls monitoring and preventing unauthorized exfiltration of sensitive data across email, web, and endpoint channels. Covers PII, PHI, PCI data, CUI, and classified business information. Aligned with NIST 800-53 SC-7(10) and ISO 27001 A.8.12.

name: Secure Media Disposal
description: Controlled destruction and disposal of storage media containing customer or sensitive data. Media sanitization per NIST 800-88 guidelines. Documented chain of custody and certificates of destruction. Required for ISO 27001 A.7.10, A.7.14 and PCI DSS Req 9.4.

name: Backup and Recovery Operations
description: Managed backup environment with dedicated servers in each data center. Automated backup schedules, retention policy enforcement, and recovery testing. Full data backups confirmed on compliance documentation. Supports BC/DR objectives and customer SLA commitments. com/compliance.

name: Cross-Border Data Transfer Safeguards
description: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) incorporated into customer DPA and supplier DPA for EU-third country transfers. Transfer Impact Assessments for high-risk jurisdictions. Supplementary measures including encryption and access controls. Covers follow-the-sun support model across 15+ countries. com/information/legal, pol-050.

name: Key Management Lifecycle
description: Cryptographic key generation, distribution, storage, rotation, and destruction procedures. RSA authentication manager for MFA token management. TLS/SSL certificate lifecycle management. Aligned with NIST 800-53 SC-12 and ISO 27001 A.8.24.

name: Data Retention and Automated Purge
description: Automated data retention enforcement aligned with regulatory requirements (7-year SOX, 6-year GDPR, sector-specific). 13-month security log retention for audit-ready compliance. Automated purge processes for expired data. com/security/on-premises-security, pol-026.

name: Data Masking and Anonymization
description: Data masking for non-production environments and anonymization for analytics/reporting where personal data is not required. Supports GDPR data minimization principle and ISO 27001:2022 A.8.11 (Data Masking). Applied to development, testing, and training environments. 8.11, GDPR Art 5(1)(c).

name: Biometric Access Control
description: Biometric scanning (fingerprint/hand geometry) required for data center entry at all Rackspace-operated facilities. Combined with badge/keycard for multi-factor physical authentication. Documented physical security policies reviewed annually. com/compliance, rackspace.com/about/data-centers, SOC 3 FY2024.

name: Badge/Keycard Access System
description: Badge and keycard protocols control access to all Rackspace data center facilities. Access cards provisioned based on manager approval, revoked within 24 business hours upon termination. Physical access documented and granted per SOC 2.02. com/compliance.

name: CCTV Video Surveillance
description: 24x7x365 security camera monitoring at all data center locations. Interior and exterior surveillance with video retention for forensic investigation and compliance evidence. Cameras integrated with access control events. com/compliance, rackspace.com/about/data-centers.

name: Visitor Access and Escort Procedures
description: Documented visitor management including pre-approval, ID verification, badge issuance, continuous escort by authorized personnel, and sign-out. Temporary access badges limited by time and area. Visitor logs maintained per PCI DSS Req 9.4 and ISO 27001 A.7.2.

provenance.primary_data_source: PCI DSS Level 1, ISO 27001 cert, SOC 2

name: Employee Background Checks
description: All data center employees carefully screened and must pass background checks before being hired. Multiple rounds of background verification. Requirement confirmed across all data center personnel. com/compliance.

name: Non-Disclosure and Confidentiality Agreements
description: All data center employees sign non-disclosure and confidentiality agreements as condition of employment. Covers handling of customer data, proprietary information, and security controls. com/compliance.

name: Uninterruptible Power Supply (N+1)
description: N+1 redundant UPS systems at all data center facilities providing protection against power outages, sags, surges, swells, spikes, and electrical noise. Instantaneous failover if main UPS fails. Dual power paths into each facility. com/compliance, rackspace.com/about/data-centers.

name: Backup Diesel Generators
description: On-site diesel generators at all data center facilities with service agreements with fuel suppliers for indefinite runtime capability. Routinely tested per maintenance schedule. Provides power continuity when utility power fails. com/compliance, rackspace.com/about/data-centers.

name: Fire Detection and Suppression
description: Fire suppression, smoke detection, and flood detection systems at all data center facilities. Clean agent suppression systems (FM-200 or equivalent) for server areas to prevent equipment damage. Annual testing and inspection per local fire codes. com/compliance.

name: HVAC and Cooling Redundancy
description: N+2 redundant chiller configuration with redundant water sources. Redundant HVAC systems with immediate failover capability. Air handling units remove dust and contaminants. Consistent temperatures maintained throughout all facilities. com/about/data-centers.

name: Third-Party Data Center Physical Controls Monitoring
description: For leased data center facilities, Rackspace maintains direct monitoring controls including annual risk assessments, review of third-party SOC reports, and periodic touchpoints with data center operators. Provides coverage over physical and environmental controls performed by subservice organizations.

name: Security Information and Event Management (Splunk)
description: Splunk SIEM provides real-time visibility across information security systems. Alerts Rackspace employees based on predefined event triggers. Aggregates logs from network devices, servers, applications, and security tools. Supports 13-month log retention for audit-ready compliance. com/security/on-premises-security.

name: 24x7x365 Security Operations Center
description: Certified Rackspace SOC experts provide continuous security monitoring across all managed environments including on-premises, colocation, AWS, Azure, and GCP. Acts as security force multiplier for customer in-house teams. Detects possible compromises and responds to issues around the clock. com/security/on-premises-security.

name: Incident Management and Response Team
description: Dedicated incident response team responsible for identification, tracking, documentation, resolution, and communication of security incidents. Appropriate resources rapidly engaged to restore disrupted services. Leaders provided timely status information for decision-making. CrowdStrike engaged as external IR partner for major incidents (confirmed Dec 2022 ransomware response). rackspace.com Dec 2022 incident update.

name: Threat Intelligence Integration
description: CrowdStrike Falcon Intel provides cyber threat intelligence feeds integrated into SOC operations. Enables proactive detection of emerging threats, IOC matching, and adversary tracking. Security posture kept up-to-date with latest threat intelligence. com/security/on-premises-security.

name: Security Log Retention (13-Month)
description: 13-month log management and retention across managed security environments to enable audit-ready compliance requirements. Covers IDS alerts, firewall logs, authentication events, system events, and application logs. com/security/on-premises-security.

name: Vulnerability Scanning
description: Automated vulnerability scanning across managed infrastructure environments. Part of security strategy and assessment services. Scans identify known vulnerabilities, misconfigurations, and compliance gaps. Results prioritized by severity for remediation. com/security/security-strategy.

name: Penetration Testing
description: Regular penetration testing using techniques employed by real attackers. Security experts evaluate environment health and provide detailed reports with remediation recommendations. FedRAMP Rev 5 mandates annual Red Team exercises in addition to standard penetration tests. com/security/security-strategy, FedRAMP Moderate.

name: Patch Management Process
description: Structured patch management process for applying security updates to operating systems, applications, and network devices. Lessons learned from Dec 2022 ransomware incident where delayed Exchange Server patching (CVE-2022-41080) contributed to compromise by Play ransomware group. Balance between patch urgency and service continuity risk.

name: Security Awareness Training
description: Mandatory security awareness training for all data center employees upon employment and annually thereafter. Covers security policies, phishing awareness, social engineering, data handling, and incident reporting. Annual recertification requirement. com/compliance.

name: Security Event Correlation and Alerting
description: Automated correlation of security events across multiple data sources (IDS, FIM, EDR, firewall, authentication) within Splunk SIEM. Predefined correlation rules and alert triggers for known attack patterns, anomalous behavior, and policy violations. Enables rapid SOC triage and response.

name: Secure SDLC Gates
description: Security checkpoints integrated into Rackspace Fabric automation pipeline and software development lifecycle. Security review required at design, code review, testing, and deployment phases. Prevents introduction of vulnerabilities into production. com/security/security-strategy.

name: Code Review and Static Analysis
description: Mandatory code review and static application security testing (SAST) before production deployment. Code quality gates enforce security standards per PCI DSS Req 6.2.3 and ISO 27001 A.8.25 (Secure Development Lifecycle).

name: Dynamic Application Security Testing
description: DAST scanning of web applications and APIs to detect runtime vulnerabilities including OWASP Top 10. Automated scanning integrated into release pipeline. Manual testing for critical applications. com/security/security-strategy, pol-069.

name: API Authentication and Rate Limiting
description: OAuth 2.0 authentication for Rackspace API endpoints. Rate limiting enforced to prevent abuse and denial of service. API documentation published at docs.rackspace.com. rackspace.com, pol-069.

name: Source Code Repository Access Control
description: Access to source code repositories restricted by role and project assignment. Version control systems enforce branch protection, merge approvals, and audit trails. Intellectual property protections for proprietary code including trade secrets.

name: Secure Configuration for Customer Portal
description: MyRackspace Customer Portal security controls including input validation, CSRF protection, secure session management, and encrypted communications. Portal is primary interface for customer environment management, firewall rules, and service requests.

name: Customer Environment Tenant Isolation
description: Logical segregation of customer environments through Organizational Units within Active Directory, VLAN isolation, dedicated firewalls, and separate storage. Customer environments appropriately segregated from other customers per SOC 2 trust services criteria.

name: Cloud Security Posture Management
description: Continuous monitoring and assessment of cloud security configurations across AWS, Azure, and GCP environments managed by Rackspace. Identifies misconfigurations, compliance gaps, and security risks. Part of Elastic Engineering for Security service. com/security/security-strategy.

name: FedRAMP Continuous Monitoring
description: Monthly vulnerability scanning, annual penetration testing, annual assessment, and continuous monitoring of security controls per FedRAMP ConMon requirements. Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M) tracking for open findings. Annual Red Team exercises per FedRAMP Rev 5.

name: Multicloud Connectivity Controls (RackConnect)
description: RackConnect Global provides secure, private connectivity between Rackspace data centers and public cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) via dedicated circuits. Eliminates need for public internet traversal. Connectivity also available through Equinix Fabric and Megaport. com/cloud/vmware.

name: Shared Responsibility Model Enforcement
description: Clear delineation of customer vs. provider security responsibilities per ISO 27017 and service agreements. Customer Data Security and Privacy Shared Responsibility Policy published. Three-document contractual framework (Service Order + MSA + Product Terms) defines boundaries. com/information/legal/GSA, pol-110.

name: Infrastructure as Code Security
description: Security controls embedded in Rackspace Fabric automation infrastructure. Automated provisioning, configuration, and deployment of customer environments with pre-validated security baselines. Reduces manual configuration errors and enforces consistency. com product descriptions, pol-067.

name: Annual Independent Security Audit
description: Independent firms perform annual audits of security controls. SOC 1 and SOC 2 Type II audits by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP. ISO 27001 certification audit. PCI DSS Level 1 assessment by Qualified Security Assessor. FedRAMP 3PAO assessment. Audit period Oct 1 - Sep 30 annually. com/compliance, SOC 2 FY2020.

name: SOC 2 Type II Control Testing
description: Annual SOC 2 Type II examination covering trust services criteria for security and availability. Controls tested for design suitability and operating effectiveness throughout the audit period. Report covers Rackspace data center hosting services system. com/compliance/soc.

name: PCI DSS Level 1 QSA Validation
description: Annual validation by Qualified Security Assessor (QSA) as PCI DSS Level 1 Service Provider. Covers all PCI DSS requirements including network security, access control, vulnerability management, encryption, monitoring, and physical security. com/compliance.

name: ISO 27001 ISMS Certification Maintenance
description: Ongoing external assessments with full reassessment every three years for ISO 27001 certification (cert IS 636168). Applies to all data center locations. Annual surveillance audits between full assessments. Statement of Applicability maintained with 93 Annex A controls. com/compliance/iso.

name: Annual Risk Assessment
description: Annual security risk assessments for in-scope environments and leased data center facilities. Results inform control selection, remediation priorities, and investment decisions. Part of ISMS risk management process per ISO 27001 Clause 6.1.

provenance.primary_data_source: SOC 3 FY2024 (third-party DC monitoring), ISO 27001 cert

name: Compliance Evidence Collection and Reporting
description: Systematic collection of compliance evidence for multiple frameworks (ISO 27001, SOC 2, PCI DSS, FedRAMP, HIPAA, HITRUST). Automated and manual evidence gathering tied to control testing cycles. Supports customer right-to-audit requirements. com/compliance, rackspace.com/security/security-strategy.

name: Policy Review Cycle (Annual)
description: ISO 27001/2-based policies reviewed at least annually per documented review schedule. Ensures policies remain current with regulatory changes, technology evolution, and organizational changes. Covers all security, operational, and compliance policies. com/compliance.

name: Change Advisory Board (CAB)
description: Change Advisory Board reviews and approves standard, normal, and emergency changes per ITIL 4 change management process. CAB ensures changes are assessed for risk, impact, and resource requirements before implementation.

provenance.primary_data_source: pol-058, ITIL 4 practices confirmed via job postings and RMC product description

name: Documented Infrastructure Change Management
description: Documented infrastructure change management procedures for all modifications to production environments. Changes logged, approved, tested, and verified before deployment. Rollback plans required. Confirmed on compliance documentation. com/compliance.

name: Incident Severity Classification (S1-S4)
description: Standardized incident severity classification from S1 (Critical - business down) to S4 (Low - minor issue) driving response times, escalation paths, and resource allocation. SLA-backed response time commitments per severity level.

name: ServiceNow ITSM Platform
description: ServiceNow platform for end-to-end IT Service Management including incident, problem, change, knowledge, and service request management. Provides ticketing, workflow automation, SLA tracking, and reporting.

provenance.primary_data_source: Service Delivery Manager job posting (Riyadh), whitepaper reference

name: Root Cause Analysis (Problem Management)
description: ITIL 4 problem management process requiring root cause analysis for recurring incidents and major outages. Known error database maintained for documented workarounds. Drives permanent fixes and continual service improvement.

name: Release and Deployment Testing
description: Test and live environment controls for release management. Service testing, validation, and configuration management before deployment to production. Prevents untested changes from impacting customer environments.

name: SLA Monitoring and Credit Process
description: Real-time SLA monitoring with automated alerting for threshold breaches. Published SLA credit request process with 30-day submission window via customer portal ticket. Product-specific SLAs for Cloud Services, Dedicated Hosting, and Managed Services. 100% Network Uptime Guarantee. com/information/legal/cloud/sla, rackspace.com/about/data-centers.

name: Disaster Recovery Testing
description: Regular DR testing including failover to backup systems and data recovery validation. Tests verify RTO/RPO objectives achievable. Lessons incorporated into BC/DR plan updates. Diesel generators routinely tested. com/about/data-centers, pol-020.

name: Geographic Redundancy
description: Data center locations across multiple geographic regions (Americas, EMEA, APAC) enabling geographic failover for customer workloads. 27+ data centers in world's most influential technical and financial markets. Interconnected by RackConnect Global private fiber. com/about/data-centers.

name: Network Redundancy (N+1 Transit)
description: Robust network with 4 transit providers ranked top 5 globally by Dyn. Ability to shift traffic as necessary with no single points of failure. Guards against provider outages and routing issues. com/about/data-centers.

name: Crisis Communication Protocol
description: Documented crisis management and communication procedures. Learned from Dec 2022 ransomware incident where customer communication challenges were publicly reported. Status page updates, customer notification, regulatory disclosure (SEC 8-K), and media coordination. com/newsroom Dec 2022 updates, Axios Dec 2022, pol-105.

name: Cybersecurity Insurance
description: Cybersecurity insurance commensurate with size of business. Company expressed confidence in ability to absorb potential financial costs from cyber incidents via insurance. $5.4M loss-recovery insurance for 2022 ransomware incident.

name: Privacy Impact Assessment Process
description: DPIA process for new processing activities, systems, and service offerings involving personal data. Assesses privacy risks and identifies mitigating controls. Required before processing that is likely to result in high risk to data subjects per GDPR Art 35.

name: Data Subject Rights Request Handling
description: Documented process for receiving, validating, and fulfilling data subject rights requests (access, deletion, portability, rectification, restriction, objection). 30-day response timeline per GDPR. Covers customer employees, Rackspace employees, and website visitors. com/en-gb/information/legal/privacy.

name: Cookie Consent Management
description: Cookie consent tool on rackspace.com implementing GDPR Art 7 consent requirements, ePrivacy Directive compliance, and CCPA opt-out rights. Granular consent categories. Cookie Notice published. com Privacy Notice reference, pol-090.

name: Supplier DPA and Data Processing Controls
description: Supplier Data Processing Agreement imposing 24-hour security incident notification, GDPR-equivalent obligations, audit rights, and sub-processor approval requirements on all third-party data processors. SCCs incorporated for cross-border transfers.

name: Breach Notification Process
description: Documented breach notification procedures meeting GDPR 72-hour supervisory authority notification, SEC Item 1.05 Form 8-K materiality disclosure, state breach notification laws, and customer contractual obligations. SEC materiality assessment embedded in IR escalation per 10-K Item 1C.

name: Privacy-by-Design in Service Development
description: Privacy considerations embedded into Rackspace service development lifecycle. Data minimization, purpose limitation, and privacy impact assessment integrated into design phase. Supports GDPR Art 25 Data Protection by Design and by Default. 8.25.

name: SOX Internal Controls Over Financial Reporting
description: Comprehensive ICFR program per SOX Section 404. CEO/CFO certification of financial statement accuracy. Segregation of duties enforced across financial processes. Annual assessment by external auditor.

name: Segregation of Duties
description: Financial transaction segregation ensuring no single individual can initiate, approve, and execute transactions. Applied to procurement, revenue recognition, accounts payable, and access management. SOX requirement.

name: Financial Approval Thresholds
description: Tiered approval thresholds for expenditures, contracts, and financial commitments. Delegation of authority matrix defines signing authorities at each management level. SOX segregation of duties compliance.

name: Disclosure Committee Review Process
description: Disclosure Committee evaluates potential materiality of events including cybersecurity incidents for SEC disclosure requirements. Escalation procedures for cybersecurity incidents to enable timely public disclosure decisions per 10-K Item 1C.

name: Insider Trading Prevention (Trading Windows)
description: Blackout periods, pre-clearance requirements, and Rule 10b5-1 plan administration for officers, directors, and designated insiders. Prevents trading on material non-public information.

name: Revenue Recognition Controls (ASC 606)
description: Five-step revenue recognition model per ASC 606 for multi-element service arrangements. 95% recurring revenue. Contract identification, performance obligation allocation, transaction price determination, and revenue allocation/recognition.

name: Whistleblower and Ethics Reporting Channel
description: Global Speak Up Policy with anonymous reporting channels (hotline, web portal) for ethics violations, fraud, bribery, and compliance concerns. Non-retaliation protections. Applicable to all employees, contractors, and business partners. rackspace.com governance documents, pol-004.

name: Third-Party Risk Assessment
description: Vendor security assessment process for all third-party service providers handling Rackspace or customer data. Includes SOC 2 report review, security questionnaires, and risk scoring. Annual reassessment for critical vendors. Applied to subservice organizations identified in SOC reports.

name: Subservice Organization Monitoring
description: Direct monitoring controls for leased data center operators and cloud infrastructure providers. Includes annual risk assessments, review of third-party SOC reports, and periodic touchpoints with operators. Provides coverage over physical and environmental controls performed by subservice organizations.

name: Supplier Code of Conduct Enforcement
description: Ethical, labor, environmental, and security standards imposed on all suppliers and subcontractors. Monitoring and enforcement through procurement process and periodic review.

name: Conflict Minerals Due Diligence
description: Supply chain due diligence for conflict minerals (3TG: tin, tantalum, tungsten, gold) per Dodd-Frank Section 1502. Supplier engagement on responsible sourcing. Annual Form SD filing with SEC.

name: Contract Lifecycle Management
description: Three-document contractual framework (Service Order + MSA + Product Terms) with defined lifecycle: creation, review, legal approval, execution, storage, renewal, and termination. Published at rackspace.com/information/legal/GSA. com/information/legal.

name: Pre-Employment Screening
description: Comprehensive pre-employment background checks for all positions with access to data centers, customer data, or sensitive systems. Multiple rounds of background verification. Part of documented hiring process. com/compliance.

name: Annual Security Awareness Recertification
description: Annual recertification requirement for security awareness training. All employees must complete training upon hire and annually thereafter. Covers current threats, policy updates, and reporting procedures. com/compliance.

name: Employee Termination Access Revocation
description: Immediate notification to TES department upon employee termination or role change. Physical access disabled within 24 business hours. Logical access revoked through SailPoint IIQ automated workflow. Equipment return process.

name: Code of Conduct Acknowledgment
description: Annual Code of Conduct acknowledgment required for all employees and contractors. Covers ethical behavior, conflicts of interest, anti-corruption, data protection, and reporting obligations. rackspace.com governance documents.

name: Diversity and Inclusion Programs (Racker Resource Groups)
description: Nine Racker Resource Groups including Together with Pride, POWER (Women's Empowerment), RISE (Black/African/African American) and six others. HRC Corporate Equality Index 100% for three consecutive years. Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality. Great Place to Work certified in 9 countries.

name: Anti-Bribery and Anti-Corruption Training
description: Targeted training on FCPA, UK Bribery Act 2010, and local anti-corruption laws for employees in high-risk roles and geographies (15+ countries). Annual recertification. Part of Global Speak Up Policy ecosystem.

name: Remote Work Security Controls
description: Security requirements for remote/flexible working arrangements including VPN usage, endpoint protection, secure home network requirements, and data handling rules. Best Place to Work for Parents Working Remotely recognition.

name: GHG Emissions Monitoring and Reporting
description: Scope 1, 2, and 3 greenhouse gas emissions tracking and reporting per GHG Protocol. CDP Climate Change reporting since 2011. Net zero carbon emissions target by 2045. 2024 HQ transition achieved 80% carbon reduction (6,007 tons CO2 reduction).

name: ISO 14001 Environmental Management System
description: ISO 14001 certified EMS (cert EMS 581182) for UK and Australian operations. Systematic environmental management including waste reduction, energy efficiency, and regulatory compliance. com/compliance.

name: Energy Efficiency Optimization
description: Data center energy efficiency programs including efficient cooling (N+2 chiller configuration), power distribution optimization, and consolidation strategies. 2024 HQ transition from LEED Gold to modern efficient facility. Part of net zero 2045 roadmap. com/about/data-centers.

name: Community Engagement (Rackspace Foundation)
description: Rackspace Foundation active since 2008 supporting community engagement, STEM education, and local charitable initiatives. Employee volunteer programs and corporate philanthropy aligned with ESG commitments.

name: Responsible AI Governance Controls
description: AI governance controls embedding fairness, transparency, accountability, and bias detection into AI service offerings (AI Anywhere). IEEE/OECD AI principles alignment. President of AI, Technology, and Sustainability C-suite oversight.

name: Customer Onboarding Security Baseline
description: Standardized security configuration applied during customer environment provisioning. Includes firewall rules, access controls, monitoring setup, and compliance baseline per service tier. Implementation Specialist/Coordinator assigned.

name: Customer Escalation Process (Fanatical Experience)
description: Tiered customer escalation process aligned with Fanatical Experience brand commitment. Account Manager, Lead Enterprise Support Engineer for Intensive tier. Monthly account reviews and capacity planning for premium customers. com service descriptions, pol-112.

name: Service Deprecation Notice Process
description: Documented End-of-Life and service deprecation notification process. Extended Lifecycle Support options for customers on deprecated platforms. Demonstrated during Hosted Exchange shutdown (migrated to M365) post-2022 ransomware incident.

name: Customer Security Vulnerability Reporting
description: Published security vulnerability reporting policy (rackspace.com/security/cloud-security-policy) enabling responsible disclosure. Defined process for receiving, validating, and remediating reported vulnerabilities. com/security/cloud-security-policy.

name: Law Enforcement Request Process
description: Documented process for receiving, evaluating, and responding to law enforcement requests for customer data. Published policy at rackspace.com/security/cloud-security-policy. Legal review required before disclosure.

name: Account Management (AC-2)
description: Automated and manual account lifecycle: creation, activation, modification, disabling, removal. Account types defined (individual, shared, group, system, guest, temporary). SailPoint IIQ manages provisioning workflows. Inactive accounts disabled per FedRAMP parameters.

provenance.primary_data_source: NIST AC-2, SOC 3 FY2024 SailPoint description

name: Automated Account Management (AC-2(1))
description: SailPoint IdentityIQ automated workflow for account provisioning, modification, and deprovisioning. Automated notifications to account managers upon account creation, modification, termination. Automated disabling of inactive accounts after defined period.

name: Access Enforcement (AC-3)
description: System-enforced access based on approved authorizations. AD group membership, RBAC policies, and firewall rules enforce access decisions. Customer environments segregated via OU structure and VLAN isolation.

name: Information Flow Enforcement (AC-4)
description: Network-layer and application-layer information flow controls between security domains. Firewall rules, VLAN segmentation, ACLs, and bastion host proxying enforce approved flows. Cross-domain transfers require explicit authorization.

name: Separation of Duties (AC-5)
description: Separation of duties enforced through RBAC and SailPoint IIQ policies. No single individual can provision, approve, and audit access. Financial transaction segregation per SOX. Change management segregation between requestor, approver, and implementer.

name: Least Privilege (AC-6)
description: Minimum necessary access granted for job functions. Privileged access restricted to personnel with demonstrated need. Elevated requests through SailPoint require manager approval. Periodic reviews validate continued need.

name: Privileged Account Audit (AC-6(9))
description: Logging and auditing of all privileged account usage. TACACS+ logs all network device commands. Bastion host sessions recorded via Balabit. Splunk SIEM correlates privileged access events.

name: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts (AC-7)
description: Account lockout after consecutive failed authentication attempts. Lockout thresholds and durations per FedRAMP parameters. Lockout events logged and alerted to SOC.

name: System Use Notification (AC-8)
description: Login banners displayed before authentication on all managed systems. Banners include authorized use notice, monitoring notification, and consent to terms.

name: Concurrent Session Control (AC-10)
description: Limit on concurrent sessions per user account for administrative and privileged access. Bastion host and VPN enforce session limits. Prevents credential sharing and reduces attack surface.

name: Remote Access (AC-17)
description: Remote access authorized, monitored, and controlled. VPN required for all remote administrative access. MFA enforced on all remote sessions. Bastion host architecture isolates remote connections from production.

name: Wireless Access Restrictions (AC-18)
description: Wireless access controlled and protected with encryption and authentication. Corporate wireless requires 802.1X. Unauthorized APs detected and disabled. Data center environments prohibit wireless to production. 8.20, FedRAMP AC-18.

name: Mobile Device Access Control (AC-19)
description: Mobile device policies enforced through MDM. Corporate data on mobile devices encrypted. Remote wipe for lost/stolen devices. Approved application lists enforced. 8.1.

name: Use of External Systems (AC-20)
description: Restrictions on connections to external information systems. Terms for external connections defined in MSA. Customer portal access governed by AUP.

name: Information Sharing (AC-21)
description: Authorized information sharing between organizational users and external parties. Data classification determines sharing restrictions. DLP enforces sharing rules. NDA requirements for sensitive data.

name: Audit Event Generation (AU-2)
description: Defined audit events generated by all in-scope systems: authentication, access control decisions, data modification, privilege escalation, configuration changes. Event types reviewed annually.

name: Content of Audit Records (AU-3)
description: Audit records include: timestamp, source, type, user identity, outcome, affected object. Additional details per FedRAMP parameters. Consistent format across platforms via Splunk normalization.

name: Audit Log Storage Capacity (AU-4)
description: Sufficient audit log storage across all production systems. Splunk centralized aggregation with 13-month retention. Storage capacity monitored and expanded proactively. com/security.

name: Response to Audit Processing Failures (AU-5)
description: Alerts on audit processing failures: log collection failures, storage capacity warnings, agent disconnections. SOC escalation for audit system degradation. Failover log collection paths.

name: Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting (AU-6)
description: SOC analysts review audit logs for IOCs, policy violations, and anomalous activity. Automated Splunk correlation rules trigger alerts. Findings reported to management and incorporated into risk assessments.

name: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation (AU-7)
description: Splunk provides audit record search, sort, filter, and report generation. Custom dashboards for compliance reporting. On-demand evidence generation for ISO, SOC, PCI, FedRAMP assessments.

name: Time Stamp Synchronization (AU-8)
description: NTP time synchronization across all in-scope systems to authoritative time sources. Consistent audit record timestamps for forensic correlation. FedRAMP requires sync to NIST Internet Time Servers.

name: Audit Log Protection (AU-9)
description: Protection of audit information from unauthorized access, modification, deletion. Splunk RBAC restricts log modification. Log integrity verification. Backup of audit records.

name: Non-Repudiation (AU-10)
description: Actions traced to authenticated identities through combined logging. Bastion host session recording via Balabit provides non-repudiation for privileged access. TACACS+ accounting logs all network commands.

name: Session Audit (AU-14)
description: Bastion host (Balabit shell control box) records all privileged sessions including keystrokes, commands, screen content. Recordings available for forensics and compliance evidence.

name: Cross-Organizational Audit Logging (AU-16)
description: Coordinated audit logging across Rackspace and subservice organizations for shared infrastructure. Customer audit log access through managed services. Log forwarding to customer SIEM where contracted.

name: Configuration Management Policy (CM-1)
description: Documented CM policy and procedures addressing purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities. Reviewed and updated annually per ISO 27001 ISMS cycle. Disseminated to relevant personnel.

name: Baseline Configuration (CM-2)
description: Documented baselines for all infrastructure: servers, network devices, security appliances. Baselines reviewed per change management. Deviations detected by FIM (Trend Micro) and config scanners.

name: Configuration Change Control (CM-3)
description: Formal change control per ITIL 4. Changes documented, tested, CAB-approved before implementation. Rollback required. Emergency change procedures defined. ServiceNow tracks all changes.

name: Security Impact Analysis (CM-4)
description: Security impact analysis required before configuration changes. Risk assessment of changes including security implications. Part of CAB review.

name: Access Restrictions for Change (CM-5)
description: Configuration changes restricted to authorized personnel. TACACS+ for network devices. AD group membership for servers. All changes logged and auditable.

name: Configuration Settings (CM-6)
description: Mandatory configuration settings per CIS Benchmarks and vendor hardening guides. Security-relevant settings documented. Deviations require risk acceptance.

name: Least Functionality (CM-7)
description: Systems configured for essential capabilities only. Unnecessary services, ports, protocols disabled. Software restriction policies limit applications. Network configs minimize attack surface.

name: Information System Component Inventory (CM-8)
description: Comprehensive inventory of hardware, software, firmware in authorization boundary. CMDB maintained in ServiceNow. Updated via change management. Automated discovery supplemented.

name: Configuration Management Plan (CM-9)
description: Documented CM plan establishing roles, responsibilities, and CM processes. Identifies configuration items, change control procedures, and baseline maintenance.

name: Software Usage Restrictions (CM-10)
description: Software installation restricted to authorized, licensed products. Open source tracked and evaluated. License compliance monitoring.

name: User-Installed Software Restrictions (CM-11)
description: Policies governing user-installed software on corporate and managed endpoints. Approved software lists enforced. Unapproved software detected and removed.

name: Contingency Plan (CP-2)
description: Documented contingency plan: essential missions, recovery objectives, restoration priorities, roles/responsibilities. Addresses natural and man-made disasters. Updated annually and after significant changes.

name: Contingency Training (CP-3)
description: Contingency training for personnel with designated roles. Tabletop scenarios and functional exercises. Records maintained.

name: Contingency Plan Testing (CP-4)
description: Annual contingency plan testing: DR failover exercises, backup restoration, communication tree activation. After-action reports drive improvements. Diesel generators routinely tested. com/about/data-centers.

name: Alternate Storage Site (CP-6)
description: Geographically separated alternate storage for backup data. 27+ data centers across Americas/EMEA/APAC. RackConnect Global enables cross-site replication. com/about/data-centers.

name: Alternate Processing Site (CP-7)
description: Alternate processing sites for failover within distributed DC portfolio. Customer workloads migratable across sites. Transfer agreements and SLAs in place. com/about/data-centers.

name: Telecommunications Redundancy (CP-8)
description: Multiple telecom providers per DC. 4 transit providers ranked top-5 globally by Dyn. No single points of failure. Traffic shifting between providers. com/about/data-centers.

name: Information System Backup (CP-9)
description: Automated backups at defined frequencies. Managed backup environment per DC. Integrity tested. Media protected during storage and transport.

name: System Recovery and Reconstitution (CP-10)
description: Recovery procedures for restoring to known secure states. Tested as part of DR exercises. Integrity verification before return to operational status.

name: MFA to Privileged Accounts (IA-2(1))
description: MFA required for all privileged account access. RSA tokens with rolling PINs. Bastion host MFA enforcement. TACACS+ authentication for network devices.

name: MFA to Non-Privileged Accounts (IA-2(2))
description: MFA for non-privileged remote access. VPN requires MFA. Customer portal supports MFA.

name: Device Identification and Authentication (IA-3)
description: Network devices authenticated before connections. TACACS+ device auth for infrastructure. 802.1X for wired/wireless. Device certificates for server-to-server communication.

name: Identifier Management (IA-4)
description: Unique identifiers for all users, devices, services. Managed through three-forest AD architecture. Inactive identifiers disabled. No reuse.

name: Authenticator Management (IA-5)
description: Authenticator lifecycle: initial distribution, lost/stolen procedures, revocation, protection requirements. Password complexity per FedRAMP. RSA token lifecycle. Certificate management.

name: Password-Based Authentication (IA-5(1))
description: Password policies enforced: minimum length, complexity, prohibited passwords list per NIST 800-63b. Compromised password detection. Password strength meters.

name: PKI-Based Authentication (IA-5(2))
description: PKI certificate validation for system-to-system authentication. Certificate revocation checking via CRL/OCSP. Certificate lifecycle managed.

name: Cryptographic Module Authentication (IA-7)
description: FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic modules for authentication in FedRAMP scope.

name: Replay Resistant Authentication (IA-2(8))
description: Authentication mechanisms resistant to replay attacks. RSA token one-time codes. Challenge-response protocols. TLS-protected authentication channels prevent session replay.

name: Re-Authentication (IA-11)
description: Re-authentication required for privilege escalation, accessing sensitive resources, and after session timeout. Bastion host re-authentication for sensitive operations.

name: Incident Response Plan (IR-1/IR-8)
description: Documented IR plan: purpose, scope, roles, coordination, compliance. Tested and updated annually. Lessons learned from Dec 2022 ransomware incident incorporated. com/newsroom Dec 2022.

name: Incident Response Training (IR-2)
description: IR training for personnel with IR roles. Simulated incidents, tabletop exercises, lessons learned reviews. Records maintained.

name: Incident Response Testing (IR-3)
description: Annual IR plan testing through tabletops, functional exercises, simulated incidents. Dec 2022 ransomware served as real-world test. After-action reports drive improvements.

name: Incident Handling (IR-4)
description: Defined procedures: preparation, detection/analysis, containment, eradication, recovery. Automated handling through SIEM/EDR. CrowdStrike Falcon automated containment.

name: Incident Monitoring (IR-5)
description: Continuous monitoring and tracking from detection through resolution. ServiceNow incident tracking. Metrics and trends analyzed.

name: Incident Reporting (IR-6)
description: Reporting to management, regulators (SEC, GDPR authorities), law enforcement, customers. GDPR 72-hour and SEC 4-day requirements.

name: Incident Response Assistance (IR-7)
description: External IR through CrowdStrike partnership. CrowdStrike engaged during Dec 2022 ransomware. Outside legal counsel for major incidents. Law enforcement coordination. rackspace.com Dec 2022.

name: Information Spillage Response (IR-9)
description: Procedures for responding to information spillage (data in wrong classification zone). Identification, containment, notification, and remediation procedures. Applies to CUI, PCI, PII spillage.

name: Maintenance Policy and Procedures (MA-1)
description: Documented maintenance policies for all system components. Scheduled maintenance windows communicated per SLA. Maintenance excluded from SLA credit.

name: Controlled Maintenance (MA-2)
description: Maintenance scheduled, performed, documented, reviewed. Records maintained. Only authorized personnel. Tools inspected. 7.13.

name: Maintenance Tools (MA-3)
description: Approved maintenance tools authorized, controlled, monitored. Tools inspected for improper modifications. Software tools checked for malware.

name: Non-Local Maintenance (MA-4)
description: Remote maintenance requires MFA, encrypted communications, session logging. Bastion host isolates remote maintenance. All activities documented and reviewed.

name: Maintenance Personnel (MA-5)
description: Maintenance personnel authorization and supervision. Escorts required for non-badged personnel. Background checks for personnel with unescorted access. Equipment lists verified. com/compliance.

name: Timely Maintenance (MA-6)
description: Spare parts and service agreements for critical components. Fuel supplier agreements for generators. N+1/N+2 redundancy reduces urgency. Vendor SLAs. com/about/data-centers.

name: Media Access Control (MP-2)
description: Digital and non-digital media access restricted to authorized personnel. Media storage areas secured. Access logged. 7.10.

name: Media Marking (MP-3)
description: Removable media marked with classification and handling restrictions. PCI CDE media marked. CUI media marked per NIST 800-171.

name: Media Storage (MP-4)
description: Sensitive media stored in controlled areas with physical access restrictions. Encryption for portable media. Storage documented in asset inventory.

name: Media Transport (MP-5)
description: Physical media transported in secure containers with chain of custody. Encrypted during transport. Tracked origin to destination. Customer equipment moves and decommissioning. 7.

name: Media Sanitization (MP-6)
description: Sanitization per NIST SP 800-88. Cryptographic erasure, degaussing, or destruction based on classification. Certificates of destruction. 4.

name: Media Use (MP-7)
description: Restrictions on types and use of removable media on managed systems. USB restrictions on production servers. Write-block requirements for forensic media.

name: Media Downgrading (MP-8)
description: Procedures for downgrading media to lower classification levels. Requires sanitization per NIST 800-88. Approval from data owner. Applicable to FedRAMP and CUI-scope media.

name: System Security Plan (PL-2)
description: SSP documenting security controls, system boundaries, interconnections, authorization status. Required for FedRAMP ATO. Updated per change management. SSP appendices cover contingency, IR, and CM.

name: Rules of Behavior (PL-4)
description: Documented rules of behavior for information system users. AUP published at rackspace.com. Employee acknowledgment required. Covers employees and customers.

name: Security Architecture (PL-8)
description: Security architecture aligned with enterprise architecture. Defense-in-depth across physical, network, host, application, data layers. Three-forest AD. Bastion host model.

name: Central Management (PL-9)
description: Centralized management of security controls across the enterprise. GRC platform for policy management, risk tracking, and compliance evidence. SailPoint for identity governance. Splunk for security monitoring.

name: Chief Information Security Officer (PM-2)
description: Chief Security Officer (Karen O'Reilly-Smith confirmed Dec 2022) with organization-wide authority. Board-level reporting on cybersecurity risk per SEC Item 1C.

name: Plan of Action and Milestones (PM-4)
description: POA&M tracking for identified weaknesses and remediation timelines. Required by FedRAMP ConMon. Tracked through GRC platform. Reviewed quarterly.

name: Security Measures of Performance (PM-6)
description: Security KPIs: IR response times, vulnerability remediation, access review completion, training completion, compliance assessment results. Reported to management.

name: Enterprise Architecture (PM-7)
description: Information security architecture as integral component of enterprise architecture. Security requirements embedded in all architecture decisions. Cloud-first strategy with security controls baked in.

name: Risk Management Strategy (PM-9)
description: Organization-wide risk strategy: tolerance, methodology, response approaches. Cybersecurity risk described in 10-K Item 1C. Board oversight.

name: Insider Threat Program (PM-12)
description: Insider threat detection, deterrence, and response. Behavioral analytics, access monitoring, DLP. Global Speak Up Policy enables reporting.

name: Security Workforce (PM-13)
description: Security workforce development program. Certified SOC personnel. ISC2 and security certifications. Specialized training for IR, GRC, security engineering.

name: Testing, Training, and Monitoring (PM-14)
description: Organization-wide security testing, training, and monitoring program. Annual pen testing, quarterly vuln scanning, monthly ConMon submissions, annual awareness training.

name: Security/Privacy Groups and Associations (PM-15)
description: Collaboration with external security groups: MITRE contributor, CIS contributor, ISACs, vendor security advisory programs. Threat intelligence sharing. com/security.

name: Threat Awareness Program (PM-16)
description: Organization-wide threat awareness encompassing phishing simulations, threat briefings, emerging threat communications. Informed by CrowdStrike Falcon Intel.

name: Position Risk Designation (PS-2)
description: Risk designation for all positions based on access to sensitive systems and data. Screening level commensurate with risk designation. FedRAMP requires risk-based position categorization.

name: Personnel Screening (PS-3)
description: Personnel screening commensurate with sensitivity of position. Multiple rounds of background checks. Re-screening for personnel with elevated access. com/compliance, SOC 2.

name: Personnel Transfer (PS-5)
description: Formal transfer process: access rights reviewed and modified when personnel transfer between roles or departments. SailPoint access recertification triggered by role change. Manager approval required.

name: Access Agreements (PS-6)
description: Personnel sign access agreements (NDA, AUP, security acknowledgment) before receiving access. Agreements reviewed and re-signed per defined schedule. Records maintained.

name: Third-Party Personnel Security (PS-7)
description: Security requirements for third-party providers including screening, access agreements, monitoring. Contractor access equivalent controls. SLA requirements for subservice organizations.

name: Personnel Sanctions (PS-8)
description: Formal sanctions process for personnel failing to comply with security policies. Progressive discipline. Removal of access for policy violations. Documented in HR records.

name: Authority to Collect PII (PT-2)
description: Documented authority for PII collection in privacy notices and DPA. Collection limited to stated purposes. Legal basis documented per GDPR Art 6 (consent, legitimate interest, contractual necessity). com/information/legal/privacy, pol-006.

name: Purpose Specification (PT-3)
description: Purposes for PII processing specified in privacy notices before collection. Processing limited to specified purposes. New purposes require updated consent or legal basis.

name: Data Tagging for PII (PT-4)
description: PII and sensitive data tagged with classification labels per data classification policy. Tags drive automated handling and access controls. Applied at collection and throughout lifecycle.

name: Privacy Notice Delivery (PT-5)
description: Privacy notices delivered to individuals at point of collection. Privacy notice published at rackspace.com/information/legal/privacy. Customer DPA provided during service onboarding.

name: Security Categorization (RA-2)
description: Systems categorized per FIPS 199 (Moderate for FedRAMP scope). Data classification drives categorization. Determines baseline control set.

name: Risk Assessment (RA-3)
description: Organization-wide risk assessment conducted annually per ISO 27001 Clause 6.1. Threat identification, vulnerability identification, likelihood and impact analysis. Results inform control selection.

name: Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning (RA-5)
description: Automated vulnerability scanning across managed infrastructure. Monthly scans per FedRAMP ConMon. Quarterly for PCI DSS. Prioritized remediation per CVSS and business criticality.

name: Vulnerability Disclosure Program (RA-5(11))
description: Public vulnerability disclosure at rackspace.com/security/cloud-security-policy. Responsible disclosure for external researchers. Coordination with security team for validation and remediation. com.

name: Risk Response (RA-7)
description: Defined risk responses: accept, avoid, mitigate, share, transfer. Cybersecurity insurance for risk transfer. POA&M for mitigation tracking. Acceptance requires management authorization.

name: Criticality Analysis (RA-9)
description: Criticality analysis identifying critical system components and functions. Business impact analysis for DR planning. Feeds into contingency planning and prioritization.

name: Threat Hunting (RA-10)
description: Proactive threat hunting by SOC team using CrowdStrike Falcon telemetry. Hypothesis-driven hunts based on threat intelligence. Results feed into detection rule improvements.

name: System Development Lifecycle (SA-3)
description: Rackspace Fabric automation platform follows defined SDLC with security at each phase. Dev/test/staging/prod segregated.

name: Acquisition Process Controls (SA-4)
description: Security requirements in acquisition contracts. Third-party products evaluated before deployment. Vendor documentation reviewed.

name: Security Engineering Principles (SA-8)
description: Security engineering principles applied in system design: defense in depth, least privilege, separation of duties, fail-safe defaults. Architecture reviews validate compliance.

name: External System Services (SA-9)
description: External services (cloud providers, SaaS) managed through third-party risk program. Service agreements define security. SOC 2 reports reviewed for subservice organizations.

name: Developer Configuration Management (SA-10)
description: Version control, change tracking, build integrity during development. Branch protection and merge approval workflows.

name: Developer Security Testing (SA-11)
description: Security testing in development: SAST, DAST, code review before deployment. Vulnerability scanning of artifacts. PCI DSS Req 6.2.3 secure coding.

name: Supply Chain Protections (SA-12)
description: Supply chain risk management for IT products/services. Supplier security evaluation. Conflict minerals due diligence. Supplier code of conduct.

name: Developer Security Architecture (SA-17)
description: Developers produce security architecture documentation describing control implementation. Design documentation reviewed by security. Required for internal and customer-facing platforms.

name: Application Partitioning (SC-2)
description: User interface separated from system management. Customer portal (MyRackspace) separated from back-end admin. Management interfaces isolated from public-facing.

name: Security Function Isolation (SC-3)
description: Security functions (auth, access control, audit) isolated from non-security. Dedicated security infrastructure separated from production workloads.

name: Denial of Service Protection (SC-5)
description: DoS/DDoS protection through multi-provider network, traffic filtering, rate limiting. 4 transit providers enable traffic shifting. Volumetric and application-layer detection. com/about/data-centers.

name: Boundary Protection (SC-7)
description: Managed interfaces at system boundaries: firewalls, IDS (Palo Alto), proxies. Deny-by-default with explicit allow. Customer firewalls managed through authenticated portal.

name: Boundary Protection — Deny by Default (SC-7(5))
description: Network devices deny all traffic by default, allow only explicit authorized connections. Firewall rules reviewed in change management.

name: Boundary Protection — Route to Proxy (SC-7(8))
description: Internal traffic routed through managed proxy points for inspection. Bastion host architecture for administrative traffic. Web proxy for outbound internet.

name: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity (SC-8)
description: Cryptographic protection for transmitted information. TLS 1.2+ for external. IPsec for site-to-site VPN. RackConnect Global private network for inter-DC.

name: Network Disconnect (SC-10)
description: Automated session termination after inactivity for network connections. Applied to VPN, bastion, admin sessions.

name: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management (SC-12)
description: Key management: generation, distribution, storage, access, rotation, destruction. FIPS 140-2 modules for FedRAMP. RSA token keys. TLS certificate lifecycle.

name: Cryptographic Protection (SC-13)
description: FIPS-approved algorithms. AES-256 at rest. TLS 1.2+ in transit. FIPS 140-2 validated modules for FedRAMP scope.

name: Public Access Protections (SC-14)
description: WAF, input validation, CSRF protection, DDoS mitigation for publicly accessible systems. Customer portal and API endpoints hardened. com/security.

name: Collaborative Computing Devices (SC-15)
description: Remote activation protections for collaborative computing devices. Camera/microphone indicators. Use restrictions in sensitive areas.

name: Public Key Infrastructure Certificates (SC-17)
description: PKI certificates issued by approved CAs. Certificate lifecycle management including renewal, revocation. CRL/OCSP validation.

name: Protection of Information at Rest (SC-28)
description: Encryption at rest for FedRAMP and PCI scope. Volume-level encryption. Database encryption for PII/PHI. Key management per SC-12.

name: Process Isolation (SC-39)
description: Separate execution domains for processes. VM isolation for customer workloads. Container isolation. Hypervisor security controls.

name: Secure Name/Address Resolution (SC-20/SC-21/SC-22)
description: Authoritative DNS source authentication. Recursive/caching resolver data integrity. DNS architecture with redundancy and integrity controls. DNSSEC where applicable.

name: Session Authenticity (SC-23)
description: Session authenticity through secure session identifiers, anti-replay tokens, CSRF protection. Cookie security attributes (Secure, HttpOnly, SameSite).

name: Fail in Known State (SC-24)
description: Systems configured to fail in a known secure state. Firewall fail-closed configuration. Application error handling defaults to deny. Recovery procedures restore known-good configurations.

name: Honeypots/Deception Technologies (SC-26)
description: Deception technologies deployed for threat detection. Canary tokens and honeypots for early warning of lateral movement. Feeds into threat hunting program.

provenance.primary_data_source: SOC operations, inferred from CSOC maturity

name: Heterogeneity (SC-29)
description: Diversity in information technologies to limit exploitation of common vulnerabilities. Multiple vendor platforms (Cisco, Palo Alto, CrowdStrike, Trend Micro) reduce single-vendor risk.

name: Flaw Remediation (SI-2)
description: Identification, reporting, remediation of software flaws. Patch management per pol-049. Critical vulns remediated within SLAs. Lessons from CVE-2022-41080 delayed patching.

name: Automated Flaw Remediation Status (SI-2(2))
description: Automated patch status tracking and reporting. Compliance dashboards showing patch levels. Automated alerting for overdue patches.

name: Malicious Code Protection (SI-3)
description: CrowdStrike Falcon NGAV across all managed endpoints. Behavioral analysis, ML detection, signature scanning. Real-time with auto-updates. SOC alerts.

name: Information System Monitoring (SI-4)
description: Comprehensive monitoring: Splunk SIEM, CrowdStrike EDR, Palo Alto IDS, Trend Micro FIM. Network and host-level. Automated alerting. 24x7x365 SOC.

name: Security Alerts and Advisories (SI-5)
description: CrowdStrike Falcon Intel threat intelligence feeds. Vendor security bulletins monitored. Advisories evaluated for applicability and urgency.

name: Software and Firmware Integrity (SI-7)
description: File integrity monitoring (Trend Micro Cloud One) detects unauthorized changes to critical system files, configs, registry. Cryptographic hash verification for deployments.

name: Spam Protection (SI-8)
description: Email spam and phishing protection. Content filtering, malware scanning, URL reputation. Customer migration to M365 post-2022 incident.

name: Input Validation (SI-10)
description: Input validation for all external-facing applications. MyRackspace portal, APIs, and customer interfaces. OWASP Top 10 mitigations.

name: Error Handling (SI-11)
description: Error messages do not reveal sensitive system information. Generic errors to users. Detailed info logged internally.

name: Memory Protection (SI-16)
description: Hardware/software memory protection: ASLR, DEP, stack canaries on production servers. Prevents memory corruption exploitation.

name: SCRM Plan (SR-2)
description: Documented supply chain risk management plan: critical suppliers, risk factors, mitigations. Annual review.

name: Supply Chain Controls Testing (SR-6)
description: Testing of supply chain controls for critical suppliers. Review of vendor SOC 2, ISO certs, security assessments. On-site for highest-risk.

name: Notification Agreements (SR-8)
description: Agreements with suppliers requiring notification of supply chain compromises, vulnerabilities, or service disruptions. Supplier DPA includes 24-hour security incident notification.

name: Physical Access Authorizations (PE-2)
description: Documented authorization for DC physical access. Access lists maintained and reviewed. Manager approval required. Correlated with personnel status. com/compliance.

name: Physical Access Monitoring (PE-6)
description: Physical access events monitored real-time. CCTV correlated with badge/biometric. Anomalous patterns investigated. After-hours alerts. com/compliance.

name: Delivery and Removal Control (PE-16)
description: Control of physical media, hardware, and equipment entering/leaving facilities. Equipment logs maintained. Authorization required for removals. 7.10.

name: Emergency Shutoff (PE-10)
description: Emergency power shutoff capability for data center rooms and equipment. Located near emergency exits. Protects personnel safety. 7.11.

name: Emergency Power (PE-11)
description: Short-term UPS (N+1 redundant, dual power paths) provides immediate power continuity. Long-term diesel generators with fuel supplier agreements. Automatic transfer switches. com/about/data-centers.

name: Emergency Lighting (PE-12)
description: Emergency lighting in data center facilities for safe evacuation. Battery-backed lighting on emergency circuits. Regular testing per fire safety codes. 7.11.

name: Water Damage Protection (PE-15)
description: Flood detection sensors in data center facilities. Raised floors where applicable. Water leak alerting to monitoring systems. com/compliance, rackspace.com/about/data-centers.

name: Temperature and Humidity Controls (PE-14)
description: Environmental monitoring for temperature and humidity within defined ranges. N+2 chiller redundancy. Alerting for out-of-range conditions. Redundant water sources. com/about/data-centers.

name: Location of Components (PE-18)
description: Information system components positioned to minimize potential damage from physical/environmental hazards. Servers elevated above flood risk. Fire zones separate from primary equipment.

name: Role-Based Security Training (AT-3)
description: Role-based training for privileged users, SOC analysts, developers, administrators. Specialized content per role risk profile. Annual completion tracking.

name: Security Training Records (AT-4)
description: Training completion records maintained for all employees. Compliance tracking and reporting. Non-completion escalation to management. Required for FedRAMP ConMon.

name: Phishing Simulation Program (AT-2(1))
description: Regular phishing simulation campaigns for all employees. Results tracked and reported. Targeted training for employees who fail simulations. Metrics feed into security awareness program.

name: Asset Discovery and Classification (CM-8(4))
description: Automated discovery of assets on the network. Classification of discovered assets per data classification policy. Unauthorized assets flagged for investigation.

name: Records Management and Retention Controls
description: Automated and manual controls for records retention per legal, regulatory, and business requirements. 7-year SOX retention. 13-month security log retention. Automated purge after retention expiry.

name: CUI Handling Controls (CUI-SP)
description: Controlled Unclassified Information handling per NIST 800-171 and FedRAMP requirements. Marking, storage, transmission, and destruction controls. CUI scope systems identified and documented.

name: Export Control Screening
description: Export control screening for technology transfers, software exports, and international business. Denied party screening. EAR and ITAR compliance.

name: HIPAA Security Controls
description: Technical, administrative, and physical safeguards for protected health information (PHI) per HIPAA Security Rule. Access controls, audit logging, encryption, and BAA requirements.

name: PCI DSS Cardholder Data Environment Isolation
description: Network segmentation isolating cardholder data environment from non-CDE systems. Quarterly ASV scanning. Annual PCI QSA assessment.

name: Quality Management System Controls
description: Quality management processes for service delivery per ISO 9001 framework. Quality metrics, process improvement, customer satisfaction tracking.

name: Capacity and Performance Monitoring
description: Automated capacity monitoring across infrastructure. Trend analysis for capacity planning. Alerts for threshold breaches. Performance baselines established.

name: Service Catalog Maintenance
description: Service catalog maintained and published. Service descriptions, SLAs, pricing, and ordering procedures. Updated as services are introduced, modified, or deprecated.

name: Knowledge Base Management
description: Knowledge management system in ServiceNow. Documented procedures, troubleshooting guides, and runbooks. Knowledge articles reviewed and updated.

name: Continual Service Improvement Process
description: Structured CSI process per ITIL 4. Service review meetings. Improvement register in ServiceNow. Metrics-driven improvement identification.

name: AML/Sanctions Screening Controls
description: Anti-money laundering and sanctions screening for business relationships per regulatory requirements. Denied party screening. OFAC compliance.

name: Cookie Consent and Tracking Controls
description: Cookie consent management platform implementing GDPR Art 7, ePrivacy Directive, and CCPA opt-out requirements. Consent recorded and auditable. Cookie classification and lifecycle management.

name: Accessibility Compliance Controls
description: Web accessibility controls per WCAG 2.1 AA standards. Automated accessibility testing in development pipeline. Third-party accessibility audits.

name: Digital Marketing Privacy Controls
description: Privacy controls for digital marketing activities. Consent-based marketing communications. Opt-out mechanisms. Marketing data handling per privacy notice.

name: Social Media Governance Controls
description: Social media usage policies for employees. Brand protection monitoring. Unauthorized disclosure prevention. Crisis social media response procedures.

name: IP and Trademark Protection Controls
description: Trademark monitoring and protection. IP assignment agreements for employees. Patent and trade secret protection procedures.

name: Workplace Health and Safety Controls
description: Workplace health and safety program per local regulations. Data center safety procedures. Ergonomic assessments for remote workers. Incident reporting and investigation.

name: Data Architecture Standards Enforcement
description: Data architecture standards for database design, data modeling, naming conventions, and data integration patterns. Architecture review board validation.

name: Data Quality Monitoring Controls
